cs213.photoAlbum.control

Interface Control

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MyControl

    public interface Control
    Control Interface describes the control logic for interactive and user modes. The control can be in two states. State one is the command line state. State two is the user mode. The control state depends if it has a user that is logged in. If there is no logged in user the control is in command mode. Once a user logs in the control goes into user mode.
    Author:
    Nadiia Chepurko

    • Method Detail

      • listUsers

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> listUsers()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns a list of user id's. If there are no users it will return an empty list.
        Returns:
        Returns the List of user id's.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addUser

        boolean addUser(java.lang.String userID,
                java.lang.String userName)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method adds a user. If the user already exists the method will not add the user.
        Parameters:
        userID - The id of new user.
        userName - The name of the user.
        Returns:
        false if user exists, true if the user was added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • deleteUser

        boolean deleteUser(java.lang.String userID)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method deletes a user. If that user does not exist nothing is done and it returns true.
        Parameters:
        userID - The id of the user to be deleted.
        Returns:
        false if user does not exist, true if the user was deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • login

        User login(java.lang.String userID)
        Return user by user ID to be used in interactive control Return null if user does not exist.
        Parameters:
        userID - The id of the user to be logged in.
        Returns:
        User object that was logged in or null if login failed.

      • getLoggedUser

        User getLoggedUser()
        Gets currently logged in user. If no user is logged in null is returned. This method is used to determine if the control runs in user mode or command mode.
        Returns:
        User object that is currently logged in or null if no user is logged in.

      • createAlbum

        boolean createAlbum(java.lang.String albumName)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new album for the currently logged in user. If the album already exists no album is created.
        Parameters:
        albumName - The name of the new album.
        Returns:
        false if album already exists, true if the album was added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • deleteAlbum

        boolean deleteAlbum(java.lang.String albumName)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deletes the user album specified by name. If the user has no album specified by name nothing is deleted.
        Parameters:
        albumName - Name of the album to be deleted.
        Returns:
        false if album does not exist for user, true if the album was deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • listAlbums

        java.util.List<Album> listAlbums()
        Returns list all albums.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of all user albums.

      • getStartAndEndDate

        java.lang.String getStartAndEndDate(Album album)
        Returns the range of dates that the photos were taken as a string.
        Parameters:
        album - Instance of album object that will be checked. It must have all photos
        Returns:
        String describing the start and end date.

      • listPhotos

        java.util.List<Photo> listPhotos(java.lang.String albumName)
                          throws AlbumNotFoundException
        Returns list the photos in an album. If there is no such album or the album is empty null is returned.
        Parameters:
        albumName - Name of the album to look in.
        Returns:
        List of photos in the album.
        Throws:
        AlbumNotFoundException - - album does not exist

      • addPhoto

        boolean addPhoto(java.lang.String fileName,
                 java.lang.String caption,
                 java.lang.String albumName)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 AlbumNotFoundException
        Adds a photo to the album. If the photo is already in the album it is not added and false is returned.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Path to the file of the new photo
        caption - Caption of the new photo.
        albumName - Name of the album that will store the photo.
        Returns:
        Returns false if photo already exists in album, true if the photo was added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - some argument has illegal value
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - fileName does not exist
        AlbumNotFoundException - - album does not exist

      • movePhoto

        boolean movePhoto(java.lang.String fileName,
                  java.lang.String oldAlbumName,
                  java.lang.String newAlbumName)
           throws AlbumNotFoundException,
                  PhotoNotFoundException,
                  java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method moves a photo from one album to another album. If one or both photos do not exist nothing is done and false is returned.
        Parameters:
        fileName - File name of the photo to be moved.
        oldAlbumName - Name of the album that will get the photo removed
        newAlbumName - Name of the album that will get the photo.
        Returns:
        Returns false if photo does exist in newAlbumName album, true if the photo was moved.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - fileName does not exist
        AlbumNotFoundException - - album does not exist
        PhotoNotFoundException - - Gets thrown when photo does not exist in oldAlbumName album.

      • removePhoto

        boolean removePhoto(java.lang.String fileName,
                    java.lang.String albumName)
             throws AlbumNotFoundException,
                    java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method removes a specified photo from an album. If the photo does not exist false is returned.
        Parameters:
        fileName - File name of the photo to be deleted.
        albumName - Name of the album the photo is in.
        Returns:
        Returns false if photo is not in album, true if the photo was deleted.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - fileName does not exist
        AlbumNotFoundException - - album does not exist

      • addTag

        boolean addTag(java.lang.String fileName,
               java.lang.String tagType,
               java.lang.String tagValue)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
               PhotoNotFoundException,
               java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method adds a tag to a photo. A tag is not added if the photo already has this tag.
        Parameters:
        fileName - File name of the photo.
        tagType - The type of the tag to be added.
        tagValue - The value of the tag to be added.
        Returns:
        Returns false if tag already exists, true if the tag was added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Gets thrown when input tagType or tagValue is invalid.
        PhotoNotFoundException - Gets thrown when photo does not exist.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - fileName does not exist

      • deleteTag

        boolean deleteTag(java.lang.String fileName,
                  java.lang.String tagType,
                  java.lang.String tagValue)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  PhotoNotFoundException,
                  java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Deletes a tag from a photo.
        Parameters:
        fileName - A file name of the photo.
        tagType - The type of tag to be deleted.
        tagValue - Value of the tag to be deleted.
        Returns:
        Returns false if tag does not exist, true if the tag was deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Gets thrown when input tagType or tagValue is invalid.
        PhotoNotFoundException - Gets thrown when photo does not exist.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - fileName does not exist

                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException

        Parameters:
        fileName - Path of photo to get.
        Returns:
        Returns Photo object or null if the photo does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - fileName does not exist

                                                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method gets a photo specified by a file name.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Path of photo to get.
        Returns:
        Returns list of albums with photo or null if the photo does not exist.
        Throws:

      • getPhotosByDate

        java.util.List<Photo> getPhotosByDate(java.lang.String startDate,
                                      java.lang.String endDate)
                               throws java.text.ParseException
        Retrieves all photos taken within a given range of dates, in chronological order Throws exception if date is invalid. Dates are of the format MM/DD/YYYY-HH:MM:SS or MM/DD/YYYY.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Start date string from command line.
        endDate - End date string from command line
        Returns:
        Returns a List of photo objects in chronological order.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - Gets thrown when input date format is invalid.

      • getPhotosByTag

        java.util.List<Photo> getPhotosByTag(java.util.List<java.lang.String> tags)
        Retrieves all photos that have the given tags. Tags can be specified with or without their types in format: tagTye:tagValue.
        Parameters:
        tags - The list of tags that the photos can have.
        Returns:
        Returns a List of photos objects in chronological order.

      • logout

        void logout()
        Logout and save session data. This method invokes the backend with the currently logged in user and the backend will save the user data. Also the currently logged in user will be set to null.
